basics.name: Jaren Pinera
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025. I aspire to become front-end engineer for gaming or media companies.

education.institution: Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI

work.company: UH Manoa- College of Natural Sciences
work.summary: Grades papers and tutors students for Math 307 course.
highlights: Assists students in linear algebra and differential equations courses
Corrects homework problem sets, quizzes, and midterm exams
Picks up and returns corrected material to professor within specified time limit

work.position: Gym Service Attendant/Arts & Crafts Teacher Assistant
highlights: Monitors gym facilities to check if courts, multi-purpose rooms, and pool are in good condition
Manages games for basketball and volleyball leagues, setting up proper equipment
Performs custodial responsibilities, such as cleaning locker rooms and restocking restroom supplies
Provides first-aid care to players, if needed
Assisted in lesson plans for arts-and-crafts classes throughout the Fall and Spring programs
Distributed supplies to elementary school students during classes
Guided students through craft projects and encouraged their creativity
Assisted in Sunday School teaching for Grade 1 students by taking attendance, filing/scanning worksheets, distributing papers and other supplies,     helping students with their work
Expressed any concerns from students to teacher
Sanitized seating area after weekly 5 PM mass attendances and reorganized seating arrangements

volunteer.summary: The Ho'opili Hou Leadership Conference was held at the University of Hawaii- West Oahu. During Spring 2019, I conducted a workshop seminar on overcoming adversity for students within the UH system.

highlights: Assisted with building the front steps for home construction, which was built for affordable housing purposes in the Lihue community

awards.title: Scholastic Honors Award
awards.summary: Recognizes graduates with the highest Associate in Science grade point average.
